CatDescriptText: Samuel Monroe, laborer, Hill District and Shirley Morris, laundry worker, Hill District were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "In what areas of endeavor or public accommodations do you find the most discrimination?"  Mr. Monroe's answer reads: "The was things are, housing is the greatest area of discrimination at the present. This is most true in the better residential areas."  Ms. Morris' answer reads: "Jobs mostly, and in schools, too."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Samuel Monroe wearing plaid shirt, standing in front building; Portrait of Shirley Morris wearing dark dress with jacquard trim and eyeglasses, standing next to car
